intro: Pinus ponderosa subsp. coulteri, commonly known as Coulter pine, is a subspecies of the ponderosa pine native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its long, slender needles and distinctive, thick, scaly bark. The cones of this species are large, woody, and often persist on the tree for many years. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Coulter pine plays an important role in local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
